tn.text: These are names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
"The Levites said to them"

tn.ref: Yahweh commanded you by the hand of Moses
tn.text: The phrase "by the hand of" means that Yahweh used Moses as the agent to deliver his command. AT: "Yahweh told Moses to command you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
This refers to the cities to be listed in the next verses.
A random method of choosing to remove the choice from the leader's will, often done with the idea that God will decide the outcome. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jos:19:01|19:1]].
This priests in this group were descendants of Levi's son Kohath. A portion of them were also descendants of Aaron, Kohath's grandson. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
numbers of cities (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
Half the tribe because the other half received their inheritance before crossing the Jordan River.
Gershon was one of the sons of Levi. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
A random method of choosing to remove the choice from the leader's will, often done with the idea that God will decide the outcome. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jos:19:01|19:1]].
Merari was one of the sons of Levi. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: Yahweh had commanded by the hand of Moses
tn.text: The phrase "by the hand of" here means that Yahweh used Moses as the agent to deliver his command. AT: "Yahweh had told Moses to command" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

The priests in this group were descendants of Levi's son Kohath. A portion of them were also descendants of Aaron, Kohath's grandson. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jos:21:04|21:2]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
A random method of choosing to remove the choice from the leader's will, often done with the idea that God will decide the outcome. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jos:19:01|19:1]].

tn.ref: Arba had been the father of Anak
tn.text: This is background information about the name of the man who founded the city of Kiriath Arba. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_background]])
This is the name of a man. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
An area of land with natural elevations, smaller than mountains.
An area covered with grass or plants suitable for the grazing of livestock or cattle.
Areas of open land, usually, planted with crops, belonging to and surrounding the city.
Small communities, usually smaller than a town.

tn.ref: Libnah ... Jattir ... Eshtemoa ... Holon ... Debir ... Ain ... Juttah
tn.text: These are all names of cities. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
The number of cities and tribes in the passage. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: From the tribe of Benjamin were given Gibeon
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "The tribe of Benjamin gave Gibeon" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
These are names of cities. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
"13 cities" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
The priests in this group were descendants of Levi's son Kohath. A portion of them were also descendants of Aaron, Kohath's grandson. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: they had cities given to them
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "they received cities" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
A random method of choosing to remove the choice from the leader's will, often done with the idea that God will decide the outcome. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jos:19:01|19:1]].
names of cities (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This refers to the list by the total number. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: From the tribe of Dan, the clan of Kohath was given Elteke
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "The tribe of Dan  gave to the clan of Kohath Elteke" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

The priests in this group were descendants of Levi's son Kohath. A portion of them were also descendants of Aaron, Kohath's grandson. See how you translated a similar phrase in [[:en:bible:notes:jos:21:20|21:20]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
These are names of cities. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This refers to the number of cities. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: From the half tribe of Manasseh, the clan of Kohath was given Taanach
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "The half tribe of Manasseh gave to the clan of Kohath Taanach" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
These are names of cities. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: two cities ... ten cities in all
tn.text: numbers of cities listed (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: clan of Kohath ... clans of the Kohathites
tn.text: The priests in this group were descendants of Levi's son Kohath. A portion of them were also descendants of Aaron, Kohath's grandson. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jos:21:04|21:2]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: From the half tribe of Manasseh, to clans of Gershon, these were other Levite clans, and they gave Golan
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "The half tribe of Manasseh, other Levite clans, received from the half tribe of Manasseh Golan" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
names of cities (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This refers to a death resulting from an action not intended to harm a person.
number of cities (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: To the clans of Gershon they also gave Kishion
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "The clans of Gershon also received Kishion" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: Kishion ... Daberath ... Jarmuth ... Engannim ... Mishal ... Abdon ... Helkath ... Rehob

tn.ref: From the tribe of Naphtali, they gave the clans of Gershon Kedesh
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "The clans of Gershon received from the tribe of Naphtali Kedesh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: The rest of the Levites—the clans of Merari—received from the tribe of Zebulun Jokneam" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
name of a person (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "The clans of Merari received from the tribe of Reuben Bezer" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This refers to the total number of cities. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
names of cities (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: Out of the tribe of Gad they were given Ramoth
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "They received from the tribe of Gad Ramoth" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This is the name of a city. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: The clans of Merari were also given Heshbon

These are names of cities. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
"12 cities in total" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: twelve cities in all were given to them by the casting of lots
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "they received these twelve cities by the casting of lots" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
A random method of choosing to remove the choice from the leader's will, often done with the idea that God will decide the outcome. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jos:19:01|19:1]].

tn.ref: The cities of the Levites taken from the middle of the land
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "The Levites received their cities from the middle of the land" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
eight cities** - "48 cities" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
"he gave an oath"

tn.ref: Not one of their enemies could defeat them
tn.text: This is stated in a negative way to strengthen the statement. AT: "They defeated every one of their enemies" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]])

tn.ref: gave all their enemies into their hand
tn.text: Here "into their hand" means "into their power." AT: "gave them power to defeat all their enemies" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: Not one thing among all the good promises that Yahweh had spoken to the house of Israel failed to come true
tn.text: This is stated in a negative way to strengthen the statement. AT: "Every one of the good promises that Yahweh had spoken to the house of Israel came true" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]])
